span.a: Click for IRCSD Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) Updates

p.span: All Indian River Central School District schools are currently closed due to the COVID-19 outbreak. Please check this space for the latest updates pertinent to our District and to access online educational resources during this unprecedented event.

img.alt: April 23, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

a.title: April 23, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

div.a: April 23, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier
div.div: Please see the attached video message from Superintendent Dobmeier for an update regarding the next phase of our plan for continued education for our students as well as food services.
div.a: Read More About April 23, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

img.alt: REMINDER: Notice Regarding Board of Education Meeting on Thursday, April 23, 2020

a.title: REMINDER: Notice Regarding Board of Education Meeting on Thursday, April 23, 2020

div.a: REMINDER: Notice Regarding Board of Education Meeting on Thursday, April 23, 2020
div.div: Pursuant to the Governor’s Executive Order No. 202.1, the IRCSD Board of Education Meeting Scheduled for Thursday, April 23rd at 6:30 PM will be closed to in-person presence by the public. The meeting will, however, be streamed live for virtual public viewing through the District’s Facebook page beginning at 6:30 PM. Additionally, the meeting will be recorded and subsequently transcribed. If you have any questions, please contact the District Clerk at 315-642-3441.
div.a: Read More About REMINDER: Notice Regarding Board of Education Meeting on Thursday, April 23, 2020

img.alt: April 16, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

a.title: April 16, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

div.a: April 16, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier
div.div: Please see the attached letter for a message from Superintendent Dobmeier in regard to the next phase of our educational-delivery and student support plan.
div.a: Read More About April 16, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

img.alt: LEGAL NOTICE

div.a: LEGAL NOTICE
div.div: Notice is hereby given that meetings of the Indian River Board of Education scheduled for the month of May, to be held in the Indian River Board of Education Room- District Office Complex, have been changed to May 7, 2020 and May 21, 2020. There will not be meetings held on May 14, 2020 and May 28, 2020. Pursuant to the Governor’s Executive Order No. 202.1, these meetings are not open to the public in person, but will be available via live stream through our district Facebook page. These meetings will be recorded and subsequently transcribed.
div.a: Read More About LEGAL NOTICE

img.alt: April 9, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

a.title: April 9, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

div.a: April 9, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier
div.div: Please see the attached letter for a message from Superintendent Dobmeier in regard to actions taken by the NY State Board of Regents to cancel all June Regents exams.
div.a: Read More About April 9, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

img.alt: NY State of Health Letter to Families

a.title: NY State of Health Letter to Families

div.a: NY State of Health Letter to Families
div.div: With the recent closure of businesses across the state, many New Yorkers are at risk of losing their health insurance coverage as a result of COVID-19. Many are likely to be eligible for health coverage with financial assistance through NY State of Health due to their loss of coverage and income. NY State of Health opened a Special Enrollment Period last month for people who are uninsured, and the Marketplace has started an awareness campaign to let people know that NY State of Health is there as a safety net in difficult times like these.
div.a: Read More About NY State of Health Letter to Families

img.alt: April 6, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

a.title: April 6, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

div.a: April 6, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier
div.div: IRCSD families and community members... at the order of Governor Cuomo, all NY schools will remain closed until at least April 29th to help maintain social distancing guidelines. This is an extension of the two-week closure increments put in place earlier through Executive Order. Additionally, June 2020 Regents exams are expected to be canceled. The official announcement and details will be made available to NY schools and the public after April 7th.
div.a: Read More About April 6, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

img.alt: Emergency School Aged Childcare and Daycare through the Watertown YMCA

a.title: Emergency School Aged Childcare and Daycare through the Watertown YMCA

div.a: Emergency School Aged Childcare and Daycare through the Watertown YMCA
div.div: Emergency childcare and daycare is available to families through the Watertown YMCA. The Watertown YMCA is allowed to care for any essential worker's children. The Department of Social Services has expanded the eligibility requirements to assist parents with childcare to 85% of the state median income. You may qualify for this childcare service.
div.a: Read More About Emergency School Aged Childcare and Daycare through the Watertown YMCA

img.alt: April 1, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

a.title: April 1, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

div.a: April 1, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier
div.div: Greetings IRCSD Students and Parents! Wow! We’ve seen some amazing examples of high-tech and low tech teaching and learning, and you are doing a great job learning from home! Thank you so much for engaging with some fun, educational, enrichment and skill-maintenance type activities over the past weeks. We also appreciate that you are staying in touch with your teachers and each other via email, phone, video, and even traditional mail. Our Warrior Team needs to stay connected during these difficult times.
div.a: Read More About April 1, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: A Message from Superintendent Dobmeier

img.alt: OCFS Parent Need for Childcare Survey

a.title: OCFS Parent Need for Childcare Survey

div.a: OCFS Parent Need for Childcare Survey
div.div: The NYS Office of Children and Family Services (OCFS) is trying its best to support families in addressing their need for high-quality childcare. The OCFS is asking parents or caregivers who require childcare to complete an OCFS Parent Need for Childcare survey.
div.a: Read More About OCFS Parent Need for Childcare Survey

img.alt: Open Wireless Access at IRCSD School Buildings

a.title: Open Wireless Access at IRCSD School Buildings

div.a: Open Wireless Access at IRCSD School Buildings
div.div: Open wireless access is now available outside of the schools of Indian River Central School District. This wireless availability is intended for academic use by our school community who do not otherwise have a reliable signal with which to engage in communications or access skill retention and enrichment activities distributed online during the school closure.
div.a: Read More About Open Wireless Access at IRCSD School Buildings

img.alt: IRCSD 1 Million Pennies Project a Success!

a.title: IRCSD 1 Million Pennies Project a Success!

div.a: IRCSD 1 Million Pennies Project a Success!
div.div: We have officially exceeded our goal of collecting 1 Million Pennies. With the help of the faculty, students, and entire community, we have collected 1,136,908 pennies, equivalent to $11,369.08.
div.a: Read More About IRCSD 1 Million Pennies Project a Success!

img.alt: EMPS is now a YMCA Emergency Childcare Site

a.title: EMPS is now a YMCA Emergency Childcare Site

div.a: EMPS is now a YMCA Emergency Childcare Site
div.div: Community Stakeholders have come together to ensure that emergency workers can continue to serve our community during this unprecedented time. The Watertown Family YMCA in collaboration with Jefferson County, School District Leaders and Healthcare Providers will open restricted Emergency Childcare Sites in Jefferson County, including one at Evans Mills Primary School.
div.a: Read More About EMPS is now a YMCA Emergency Childcare Site

img.alt: Indian River Class Leaders 2020

div.a: Indian River Class Leaders 2020
div.div: Indian River High School is proud to announce the academic leaders of the Class of 2020. They are: Valedictorian, Shun Lei Win, daughter of Kyi Kyi Nyunt and Zaw Myint, from Evans Mills, New York; Salutatorian, Dennis Santos Sanchez, son of Hellen and Pedro Santos, from Calcium, New York, and Vocational Leader, Jaynne Alcock, daughter of Michelle and Joseph Alcock from Evans Mills, New York.
div.a: Read More About Indian River Class Leaders 2020

img.alt: Drive-Up Meals Offered for IRCSD Pre-K through 12th Grade Children!

a.title: Drive-Up Meals Offered for IRCSD Pre-K through 12th Grade Children!

div.a: Drive-Up Meals Offered for IRCSD Pre-K through 12th Grade Children!
div.div: If you have a child enrolled Pre-K through 12th grade in our District, it's as easy as visiting one of our Distribution Sites. Drive up and wait in your vehicle. Share the number of school-aged children in your household. A breakfast and a lunch meal will be brought to you for each child for each school day. And you are on your way! Please visit one site closest to your home for all of your children!
div.a: Read More About Drive-Up Meals Offered for IRCSD Pre-K through 12th Grade Children!

img.alt: March 14, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: Joint statement from J-L BOCES and Public Health

a.title: March 14, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: Joint statement from J-L BOCES and Public Health

div.a: March 14, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: Joint statement from J-L BOCES and Public Health
div.div: Steve Todd, Superintendent of Jefferson-Lewis BOCES, just made a joint statement from local Superintendents, County Officials, and the Departments of Health describing that all Jefferson-Lewis school student attendance will cease immediately. It is important to note that this is a preventative measure and NOT a result of any confirmed COVID-19 cases in the region.
div.a: Read More About March 14, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update: Joint statement from J-L BOCES and Public Health

img.alt: March 13, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update

div.a: March 13, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update
div.div: Like you, we have been closely following the evolution of the COVID-19 virus and related responses across the country and around the world, with special attention to our own region. The Pre-K-12 school guidance issued jointly by the NYS Department of Health and the NYS Education Department is being followed regarding preparation and response to COVID-19. Our response planning includes the areas of prevention, responsiveness/communication, education, stability, and support systems. Given the moment-to-moment changes in this guidance, our plans are evolving rapidly.
div.a: Read More About March 13, 2020 IRCSD COVID-19 Update

img.alt: IRCSD 1 Million Pennies Project - March 9 Update

a.title: IRCSD 1 Million Pennies Project - March 9 Update

div.a: IRCSD 1 Million Pennies Project - March 9 Update
div.div: We are off to a great start on our 1 Million Pennies Project. Students across the district have been learning through the collection of pennies. They are counting, debating, calculating, drawing, and most importantly, discovering and growing. We are almost there with a total of 625,136 pennies so far! They are proudly displayed in our high school lobby, and more are counted and added weekly. We want to thank all of our students, faculty and community members that have contributed to the projects success so far! We can’t wait to see what 1 million looks like!
div.a: Read More About IRCSD 1 Million Pennies Project - March 9 Update

img.alt: Follow-up to Recent Letter Regarding 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19)

a.title: Follow-up to Recent Letter Regarding 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19)

div.a: Follow-up to Recent Letter Regarding 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19)
div.div: Please click the link below to access a follow-up to our recent letter regarding the 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19). This letter contains important proactive practices and preventative actions the District is taking in response to this situation.
div.a: Read More About Follow-up to Recent Letter Regarding 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19)

img.alt: 2020-2021 Universal Pre-Kindergarten Program Application now available!

a.title: 2020-2021 Universal Pre-Kindergarten Program Application now available!

div.a: 2020-2021 Universal Pre-Kindergarten Program Application now available!
div.div: If your child resides in the Indian River Central School District and will be 4 years of age on or before December 1, 2020, they are eligible to participate in our Universal Pre-Kindergarten program at Calcium, Evans Mills, and Philadelphia Primary. Submit your application by April 20, 2020 to be included in the first placement lottery.
div.a: Read More About 2020-2021 Universal Pre-Kindergarten Program Application now available!

img.alt: Opt In to SchoolMessenger Text Messaging today!

a.title: Opt In to SchoolMessenger Text Messaging today!

div.a: Opt In to SchoolMessenger Text Messaging today!
div.div: Did you know you can opt in to SchoolMessenger's free text messaging service to receive important information about Indian River Central School District events, school closings, safety alerts, and more? Just send a text message of "Y" or "Yes" to our school's short code number, 67587. We will be testing our emergency broadcast system soon with general messages.
div.a: Read More About Opt In to SchoolMessenger Text Messaging today!

img.alt: 2019-2020 Free or Reduced Price Meal Application now available

a.title: 2019-2020 Free or Reduced Price Meal Application now available

div.a: 2019-2020 Free or Reduced Price Meal Application now available
div.div: The Indian River Central School District recognizes that children need healthy meals to learn. To find out if your children are eligible to receive free or reduced price meals, fill out the 2019-2020 Free or Reduced Price Meal Application today.
div.a: Read More About 2019-2020 Free or Reduced Price Meal Application now available
